descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: We will read about how to become a scholar - a wise person. What are the steps, and methods to become a wise person. Listening, pondering - thinking, and meditation are some that we will discuss and deal in Tibetan language.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: To understand the terms, words used to express the experiences felt in terms of relating to worldly truth - pain and pleasure. Like the words ?Thoes ? and ?Sam' and "Gom' in Tibetan. They mean "listening" and "thinking" and "meditating'. We will try to understand why and what are the situations we need to create for these learning processes to get used to in our daily life.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: I tried to express these through dramatization; and literal translation and explanation of the terms.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Experiential and literal translation.
Daily communications through conversations in Tibetan on regular bases (Every time we meet).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Read two books:

1 - Khapa la Jukpai Goe - Becoming wise person - by Sakya Pandita
2 - Chu-Shing Tenchod - Similes of water and wood - by Gung Thang Tempai Dolme
